DataElement.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for the cancer of the vagina based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined prior to treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to clinical evaluated N stage of vaginal tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relating to the vagina or to any sheath.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the vagina.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Update to use Property based on NCIt concept

ValueDomain.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 N Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of vaginal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._The extent of a cancer within the body, especially whether the disease has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Vaginal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer without regional lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer with pelvic or inguinal lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Vaginal Cancer pN1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Vaginal cancer with pelvic or inguinal lymph node metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Vaginal cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Vaginal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Vaginal cancer in which regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
